intro: Hibbertia canescens, commonly known as the silver hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as Queensland and New South Wales. Hibbertia canescens is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers appear in spring and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
